item.title: Transfer representation for a case before the USPTO to a different agent or attorney
item.description:
How you transfer a case depends on whether the case is a pending application, an issued patent, or a PCT Application. Each of these cases is discussed below.

Transferring a Pending Application

For a pending U.S. Patent Application where the assignee-applicant was named as the applicant when the application was filed, use this form.

This form has Parts A, B, and C. Part C is only useful if there is not customer number, so I’m going to ignore Part C.

Part A has fields that identify the application being transferred and includes application specific data, such as an Application Number and Confirmation Number. Accordingly, Part A is different for each patent application you are transferring.

Part B identifies the assignee-applicant and requires the client’s signature. A client can sign Part B once, and a copy of Part B can be attached to a copy of Part A for each patent application.

Transferring an Issued Application

For an issued U.S. Patent, use the following form: Power of Attorney or Revocation of Power of Attorney With a New Power of Attorney and Change of Correspondence Address.
